title: Brighton Toy and Model Museum
description: Brighton Toy and Model Museum is one of the World's great toy museums. Located in the artists city of Brighton on Britain's South Coast, and densely packed into a set of four Victorian cellars covering four thousand square feet, the museum's displays draw on guest collections and a core collection of over ten thousand items.

title: Clock Tower
description: The Clock Tower (sometimes called the Jubilee Clock Tower) is a free-standing clock tower in the centre of Brighton, part of the English city of Brighton and Hove. Built in 1888 in commemoration of Queen Victoria's Golden Jubilee, the distinctive structure included innovative structural features and became a landmark in the popular and fashionable seaside resort.

title: Royal Pavillion
description: The Clock Tower (sometimes called the Jubilee Clock Tower) is a free-standing clock tower in the centre of Brighton, part of the English city of Brighton and Hove. Built in 1888 in commemoration of Queen Victoria's Golden Jubilee, the distinctive structure included innovative structural features and became a landmark in the popular and fashionable seaside resort.

title: British Airways i360
description: Breathtaking views are best admired with a glass in hand! Enjoy a drink from the South Coast’s highest bar, the Nyetimber Sky Bar. a wide selection of drinks are available included local beers from Harvey Brewery, wines from Nyetimber, Brighton Gin and Folkington’s juices from nearby orchards.

title: Brighton Museum & Art Gallery
description: Brighton Museum & Art Gallery is located in the Royal Pavilion garden, at the heart of the city’s cultural quarter. Its diverse collections bring together the arts and history to tell stories about the city and the world we live in.
address: Royal Pavilion Gardens, Pavilion Parade, Brighton

title: Foodilic
description: Rustic, all-day cafe-eatery offering a healthy salad-oriented buffet with veggie and vegan options.

title: Little Miss Piggies
description: Family run café serving traditional English breakfasts, bruch and snacks & drinks at affordable prices. All food 'home' cooked on the premises and a 'create your own' breakfast is also available with prices from 50 pence.

title: Wheat & Beans
description: Artisan food and coffee on the go, inspired by the flavours of the Mediterranean and beyond. Located in the ever-fascinating city of Brighton, UK.

title: Cakes The Difference
description: Amazing home baked cakes and home made meals. Made in Brighton by the Queen cake baker Denise.

title: Julien Plumart Cafe
description: Amazing home baked cakes and home made meals. Made in Brighton by the Queen cake baker Denise.

title: Leman Tea Room
description: Small, probably the smallest tea room in Brighton. Traditional English design, vintage table settings. Serving homemade cakes, freshly made sandwiches, Leman style breakfasts, Cream and Afternoon Teas, wide selection of teas as well as coffees and other soft drinks.

title: Cafe An-An
description: 'an-an' means the little house of Anko(or an, paste made from adzuki bean with sugar). Anko is the most important part of Wagashi. Virtually fat free, full of fiber, vitamins and minerals, fully vegetarian safe and mostly vegan safe.

title: Stanmer Park Local Nature Reserve
description: With its beautiful woodland walks and extensive open lands, Stanmer Park is just as perfect for a family picnic as it is for a kick about with your friends or those looking for a bracing walk over the Downs.

title: Preston Park
description: Preston Park is the largest urban park in the city. Whether you want to take part in sports or sit and enjoy a picnic on a summer’s day, Preston Park is the perfect place to go.

title: Queens Park
description: The Friends of Queens Park, working in partnership with Brighton & Hove City Council, is inviting people to help decide on the first project from the draft Queens Park Conservation Management Plan, funded from developer’s contributions to the park.

title: Hove Park
description: Hove Park is popular with local residents, dog walkers and runners. The park features a mix of large areas of open grass, mature trees, flower beds and recreational facilities including a miniature railway.

title: Brighton Palace Pier
description: Opened in 1899 and home to fairground rides, bars, restaurants and deckchairs to enjoy the sea view.

title: Redroaster Cafe
description: Redroaster was one of the first specialist coffee houses in the UK when they set up in 2000, still to this day, they are the only certified organic roastery in the south. They roast up their beans every day to ensure they’re serving the freshest coffee.

title: Small Batch Coffee Roasters
description: Winner of BRAVO ‘Best Coffee’ for 2 years running, Small Batch Coffee Company take quality coffee very seriously and deliver it with a relaxed, uniquely Brighton edge. The central Brighton branch is located below MyBrighton on Jubilee Street with additional branches across Brighton, Hove.

title: Small Batch Coffee Roasters
description: Winner of BRAVO ‘Best Coffee’ for 2 years running, Small Batch Coffee Company take quality coffee very seriously and deliver it with a relaxed, uniquely Brighton edge. The central Brighton branch is located below MyBrighton on Jubilee Street with additional branches across Brighton, Hove.

title: The Flour Pot Bakery
description: The Flour Pot Bakery grew out of a commitment to all things artisanal and delicious in food. Offering fresh bread and pastries, homemade sandwiches and fantastic Small Batch coffee, these bakers are bringing carbohydrates back with aplomb. All of the Flour Pot Bakery shops stock and sell their own bread. Bread can be ordered in advance (before 3pm) from shops, or for next day collection and cakes can also be pre-ordered.

title: Chard
description: The exciting new restaurant Chard Brighton offers a chic and welcoming cafe by day which transforms into a romantic restaurant by night boasting a small but carefully crafted fine dining menu of locally-sourced, seasonal ingredients at a charming venue on Western Road.

title: Coppa Club
description: New kids in town, Coppa Club are open from 8 am to fill all your caffeine related needs. Freshly ground beans make for a mean flat white, and the organic tea list is one to be reckoned with.

title: Lucky Beach Cafe
description: New kids in town, Coppa Club are open from 8 am to fill all your caffeine related needs. Freshly ground beans make for a mean flat white, and the organic tea list is one to be reckoned with.
address: Kings Road Arches, 183 Kings Rd, Brighton

title: Cafe Marmalade
description: Whether it’s the delicious Wake Up Smoothie served in a jam jar, a paper-wrapped take-out sandwich for lunch, the platters piled with imaginative salads, very good coffee and sumptuous cakes and scones, Marmalade has become an all-day Kemptown institution for school-runners, hospital staff, dog and toddler walkers and locally-based creatives.

title: Churchill Square Shopping Centre
description: Churchill Square, named after the UK Prime Minister Winston Churchill, is the principal shopping centre in the centre of Brighton and Hove, a city on the south coast of England. It is at the eastern end of Western Road, near the Clock Tower.

title: Volk's Electric Railway
description: Volk's Electric Railway (VER) is a narrow gauge heritage railway that runs along a length of the seafront of the English seaside resort of Brighton.
address: Volk's Electric Railway Visitor Centre, Madeira Dr, Brighton

title: Hove Museum
description: Step into a world of toys, cinema, local history, and fine art. Hove Museum & Art Gallery is a family friendly museum with one of the finest craft collections in the UK.

title: GAIL's Bakery
description: Whilst being a chain, the Hove café has a really homely feel. Who can resists these yummy-looking baked goods?

title: The Goldstone
description: WHO WOULD HAVE THOUGHT THAT a serene family park in suburban Hove was once a honeypot for Druidic worship and sacrifice? What appears to be just another boulder is in fact the fabled Goldstone, a 20-ton lump of sandstone and flint with flecks of gold sprinkled throughout giving the rock its name. And while the Goldstone itself isn’t that awe-inspiring, its story is much more compelling.

title: Hove Park Cafe
description: Hove Park's hub, The Hove Park Cafe, both food and drink hot and cold.

title: Dyke Road Park Cafe
description: Located in the middle of Brighton & Hove with surroundings of a peaceful rose garden, blue seas and overlooking a city view.

title: Hilltop Cafe
description: A small independent cafe located on Dyke Road Brighton serving Gourmet Burgers, Brunch and Coffee. We serve local meat, bread & coffee sourced from sussex.

title: West Blatchington Windmill
description: Dating from the 1820's, this Grade II Listed building still has all the original mill workings in place. Visitors can discover how grain is turned into flour in a traditional smock windmill and also explore a fascinating display of historical and agricultural exhibits.
